Partner with organization leaders to effectively align with and support key initiatives.
Builds and retains high performance teams by hiring, developing and motivating skilled professionals.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Vice President of Accounting - CAO

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance, General Business

Description:
Reporting to the CFO, the VP Finance/Chief Accountant will be a critical leader in the accounting function. They will own the Global accounting function, including accounting operations, financial reporting and technical accounting, revenue accounting, financial applications and systems, regulatory compliance, taxes, and treasury and cash management.A successful candidate will leverage an outstanding technical accounting and process automation background, strong business acumen, and overall leadership skills to lead the functions within the Controllership group. This position will manage a Houston based team of [] that can adapt to the ever-changing demands of this company’s rapidly evolving business.The CAO will partner closely with the CFO, Corporate Development group, Capital Formation group, and other executives on not just accounting and reporting matters but to help inform on goals and initiatives. This includes developing partnerships with key stakeholders to ensure alliance on the accounting related impacts of business initiatives. Major Responsibilities:Lead all areas of global accounting, from the transactional to the highly technical. Accounting operations, accounts payable and treasury, technical accounting, consolidations, management reporting.Oversee month-end closing process for each legal entity including bank reconciliations, supporting all balance sheet accounts, recording accruals, adjusting journal entries, and analyzing results.Present company financials and operating results to executive leadership team and investorsAssist with creating and implementing policies and procedures, and identify, resolve, and document accounting and operational issues.Manage consolidated annual audit and tax matters.Manage the formulation of budgets and forecasts and preparation of variance analyses.Assist CFO in developing and performing timely analysis and reporting on operational performance as it relates to the business activities and trends.Manage network of accounting systems and partners that scale with the growth of the brand.Interface with external auditors/internal stakeholders to execute and lead year-end consolidated external audits.Manage centralized Treasury division to control company liquidity, manage a wide network of banking relationships, and implement a system of cash management controls.Partner in acquisition/divestiture of subsidiaries by providing expertise on financial implications of the transaction.Drive maturation process of post-acquisition integration function by developing integration playbooks across multi-department and function groups.Build scalable integration function for potential M&A growth.
Drive to achieve the highest level possible of innovation in all matters related to accounting. Be a thought leader and real champion as we continue to optimize and more fully automate accounting and related transactionsServe as the key business partner for all accounting-related matters to entire organization, including key department stakeholders.In partnership with FP&A and others, ensure the preparation and analysis of all financial reports meet the organization's needs, including Internal Reporting, Board of Directors, External Auditors, and Investors requirements, and comply with governmental reporting requirements and global regulations.Advise management of potential changes in accounting regulations or practices that may impact operations and reporting. Stay abreast of US GAAP, IFRS, and SEC developments, including participation in outreach with regulators and industry peers.Serve as the executive accounting sponsor and primary contact for cross-functional teams, such as new company initiatives, M&A, strategic finance projects, systems improvements and optimizations and other projects as they arise. In the spirit of partnership, provide accounting advice and guidance in support of the business meeting their objectivesTHE PERSONThe ideal candidate brings vast experience in various types of organizations. You have worked at scale in a data-intensive environment. You thrive in trying to enhance processes to make them more efficient. You are an inspirational leader who can learn quickly, contribute immediately and mentor a dynamic team of professionals. Specifically, the ideal candidate will possess:15-20 years of experience in accounting with many of those years in a leadership role at a high-growth business. Ideally you have managed something outside accounting (financial systems, tax, planning). Preferably at scale – millions of transactions, hundreds of millions or billions of revenueBe a CPA. Or former/inactive CPA. Ideally, some Big 4, some multinational accounting operations. Deep accounting expertise is a given.Systems know how is a must. You will be a thought leader in improving the existing systems and processes and identifying and implementing the needed upgrades to existing infrastructure. NetSuite experience is great, but not requiredBring a track record of leadership across multiple disciplines. Part player, part coach you are comfortable digging in and being hands-on when necessary while simultaneously mentoring, developing, supporting the team Aerospace a plus; DCAA a plus; late-stage venture/early stage growth experience a plus; IPO readiness a plus

EDUCATIONBachelor's degree or higher in accounting or a related field. CPA (active/inactive) required. MBA a plus.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
<JD_END>
